column4: so ive found something that annoys me, which is that if im playing music of some sort, and my computer comes under a heavy processing load, the music will skip, is there a way to prevent this?
only if you up the nice level of the other stuff you are doing, I think.
actually try running the music player from the command line preceeded by nice 0 or so.   "man nice" for how to use nice
ok do this find /etc -type f -name "dosbox.conf" -print
I think that should find it if it is in the /etc directory
i get zilc
Ok, I'm thinking that there isn't one there then heh
did you install from Synaptic or apt or some such?
i installed using the add/remove feature
ok good... give me a minute and I'll see if i remember how to do something
I *think* that dpkg -S dosbox.conf should work
whatll that do? tell me where dosbox.conf is?
I don't have dosbox.  That will tell dpkg to search for the packages that have dosbox.conf  so should tell you where it installed it
so will this dpkg tell me where any app is installed?
it will tell you where a particular file is, if you installed it the normal way
im with you, and i currently have no idea where to put this config file so that dosbox will load it at startup
See, it is all about finding something, and editing it... it should not be about finding something, figure out where to put it and then figure out how the hell to get it to work at all
you have to compile DOS source code?
YES
i need to compile DOS source into a DOS executable to be run in DOSbox
what the hell... I don't think I ever thought that would be something anyone would ever need to do... Compile DOS source so can run a DOS emulator to run on Linux
If you had a compiler... maybe...
i have the compiler
so have to run a DOS compiler under an emulator on linux to compile DOS code on Linux so can run a DOS emulator to run a game on Linux
